p: Land cover data were obtained from NASAâ€™s Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) website. These data (referenced as MCD12Q1 product) has a spatial resolution of about 10 x 10km and has seven main LC types including forests, woodlands, grasses/cereals, shrublands, cropland/mosaics, wetlands and unvegetated areas [ 30]. In these data, a given LC type (savannah, forest, urban, crops, and wetland) ought to cover more than 50% of a pixel for that LC type pixel to be ascribed to the pixel, otherwise, the pixel would have a zero value for that LC type.
